unnormalised: EV Charging Getting a Power Boost, Finally!
normalised: E V Charging Getting a Power Boost, Finally!

unnormalised: Hey auto enthusiasts! Remember that scene in 'Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge' where Raj misses the train? Well, finding an EV charger used to feel like that – a frustrating miss! But things are (slowly) changing.
normalised: Hey auto enthusiasts! Remember that scene in 'Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge' where Raj misses the train? Well, finding an E V charger used to feel like that – a frustrating miss! But things are (slowly) changing.

unnormalised: IIT Madras just announced a breakthrough in fast-charging tech. Apparently, they’ve managed to significantly reduce charging times, aiming to get your Nexon EV juiced up quicker than you can say "Ja Simran ja, jee le apni zindagi!"
normalised: I I T Madras just announced a breakthrough in fast-charging tech. Apparently, they’ve managed to significantly reduce charging times, aiming to get your Nexon E V juiced up quicker than you can say "Ja Simran ja, jee le apni zindagi!"

unnormalised: Meanwhile, Tata Power is aggressively expanding its charging network across highways, particularly on routes connecting Delhi to Jaipur and Mumbai to Pune. They're aiming to have a charger roughly every 100 km, making those long drives a whole lot less anxiety-inducing.
normalised: Meanwhile, Tata Power is aggressively expanding its charging network across highways, particularly on routes connecting Delhi to Jaipur and Mumbai to Pune. They're aiming to have a charger roughly every one hundred kilometer, making those long drives a whole lot less anxiety-inducing.

unnormalised: However, cost is still a major factor. Public charging can easily set you back Rs. 15-20 per unit. Plus, finding a functional charger is still sometimes a matter of luck. Let's hope these developments pick up speed faster than a souped-up Maruti 800 on the Yamuna Expressway!
normalised: However, cost is still a major factor. Public charging can easily set you back rupee fifteen to twenty per unit. Plus, finding a functional charger is still sometimes a matter of luck. Let's hope these developments pick up speed faster than a souped-up Maruti eight hundred on the Yamuna Expressway!
